alert.note: Alert for Stark (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 07 at 6:46PM EST until March 08 at 4:33PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio... Black River At Elyria affecting Lorain County. Eagle Creek Above Findlay affecting Hancock County. Eagle Creek At Phalanx Station affecting Trumbull County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Nimishillen Creek Near North Industry affecting Stark County. Killbuck Creek Near Killbuck affecting Holmes and Wayne Counties. For the Black River...including Elyria...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Nimishillen Creek...including North Industry...Major flooding is forecast. For the Eagle Creek (Hancock)...including Findlay...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Eagle Creek (Trumbull)...including Phalanx Station...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Nimishillen Creek Near North Industry. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Water inundates the first floor of homes in Canton and North Industry. Central Avenue Southeast floods in Canton Township. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 PM EST Monday the stage was 12.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:15 PM EST Monday was 13.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.2 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight by 445 AM EST.
